br.eti.rslemos.bitsmagic

Class Ones

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.eti.rslemos.bitsmagic.Ones

  • public class Ones
extends Object
    This class consists exclusively of static methods that count set bits on integral primitive types, or arrays of integral primitive types.

    For every method available in this class, the arguments that represent offsets should always be given in bits, and are 0-based. For more information about bit mapping in arrays of integral primitive types see Store class.

    Offlimits bits are hardwired to 0: they never increment the count of set bits. Methods in this class should never throw ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.

    NullPointerException is thrown if the given array is null.

    All methods are inherently thread unsafe: in case of more than one thread acting upon the same storage the results are undefined. Also neither they acquire nor block on any monitor. Any necessary synchronization should be done externally.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Rodrigo Lemos
    See Also:
    Store

      • ones

        public static int ones(byte[] data,
                       int from,
                       int to)
        Returns the count of bits set in the specified region of the given storage. The range considered extends from offset from, inclusive, to offset to, exclusive. If to <= from this method returns 0.
        Parameters:
        data - storage array.
        from - offset, in bits, 0-based, of the first bit (inclusive) to be counted.
        to - offset, in bits, 0-based, of the last bit (exclusive) to be counted.
        Since:
        1.0.0
